   20: -module(epp_SUITE).
   21: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   22: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   23: 
   24: -export([rec_1/1, include_local/1, predef_mac/1,
   25: 	 upcase_mac_1/1, upcase_mac_2/1,
   26: 	 variable_1/1, otp_4870/1, otp_4871/1, otp_5362/1,
   27:          pmod/1, not_circular/1, skip_header/1, otp_6277/1, gh_4995/1, otp_7702/1,
   28:          otp_8130/1, overload_mac/1, otp_8388/1, otp_8470/1,
   29:          otp_8562/1, otp_8665/1, otp_8911/1, otp_10302/1, otp_10820/1,
   30:          otp_11728/1, encoding/1, extends/1,  function_macro/1,
   31: 	 test_error/1, test_warning/1, otp_14285/1,
   32: 	 test_if/1,source_name/1,otp_16978/1,otp_16824/1,scan_file/1,file_macro/1,
   33:    deterministic_include/1, nondeterministic_include/1]).
   34: 
   35: -export([epp_parse_erl_form/2]).
   36: 
   37: %%
   38: %% Define to run outside of test server
   39: %%
   40: %%-define(STANDALONE,1).
   41: 
   42: -ifdef(STANDALONE).
   43: -compile(export_all).
   44: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   45: -define(config(A,B),config(A,B)).
   46: %% -define(t, test_server).
   47: -define(t, io).
   48: config(priv_dir, _) ->
   49:     filename:absname("./epp_SUITE_priv");
   50: config(data_dir, _) ->
   51:     filename:absname("./epp_SUITE_data").
   52: -else.
   53: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   54: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   55: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   56: 
   57: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: end_per_testcase(_, _Config) ->
   61:     ok.
   62: -endif.
   63: 
   64: suite() ->
   65:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   66:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   67: 
   68: all() ->
   69:     [rec_1, {group, upcase_mac}, include_local, predef_mac,
   70:      {group, variable}, otp_4870, otp_4871, otp_5362, pmod,
   71:      not_circular, skip_header, otp_6277, gh_4995, otp_7702, otp_8130,
   72:      overload_mac, otp_8388, otp_8470, otp_8562,
   73:      otp_8665, otp_8911, otp_10302, otp_10820, otp_11728,
   74:      encoding, extends, function_macro, test_error, test_warning,
   75:      otp_14285, test_if, source_name, otp_16978, otp_16824, scan_file, file_macro,
   76:      deterministic_include, nondeterministic_include].
   77: 
   78: groups() ->
   79:     [{upcase_mac, [], [upcase_mac_1, upcase_mac_2]},
   80:      {variable, [], [variable_1]}].
   81: 
   82: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   83:     Config.
   84: 
   85: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   86:     ok.
   87: 
   88: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   89:     Config.
   90: 
   91: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   92:     Config.
   93: 
   94: %% Recursive macros hang or crash epp (OTP-1398).
   95: rec_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   96:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac.erl"),
   97:     {ok, List} = epp_parse_file(File, [], []),
   98:     %% we should encounter errors
   99:     {value, _} = lists:keysearch(error, 1, List),
  100:     check_errors(List),
  101:     ok.
  102: 
  103: include_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  104:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  105:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "include_local.erl"),
  106:     FooHrl = filename:join([DataDir,"include","foo.hrl"]),
  107:     BarHrl = filename:join([DataDir,"include","bar.hrl"]),
  108:     %% include_local.erl includes include/foo.hrl which
  109:     %% includes bar.hrl (also in include/) without requiring
  110:     %% any additional include path, and overriding any file
  111:     %% of the same name that the path points to
  112:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [DataDir], []),
  113:     {value, {attribute,_,a,{true,true}}} =
  114: 	lists:keysearch(a,3,List),
  115:     [{File,1},{FooHrl,1},{BarHrl,1},{FooHrl,5},{File,5}] =
  116:         [ FileLine || {attribute,_,file,FileLine} <- List ],
  117:     ok.
  118: 
  119: file_macro(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  120:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  121:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "file_macro.erl"),
  122:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  123:                                        {source_name, "Other source"}]),
  124:     %% Both attribute a and b are defined as ?FILE, they should be the same
  125:     {attribute,_,a,FileA} = lists:keyfind(a, 3, List),
  126:     {attribute,_,b,FileB} = lists:keyfind(b, 3, List),
  127:     "Other source" = FileA = FileB,
  128:     ok.
  129: 
  130: deterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  131:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  132:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "deterministic_include.erl"),
  133:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  134:                                        {deterministic, true},
  135:                                        {source_name, "deterministic_include.erl"}]),
  136: 
  137:     %% In deterministic mode, only basenames, rather than full paths, should
  138:     %% be written to the -file() attributes resulting from -include and -include_lib
  139:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  140:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{"baz.hrl",_Line}}) -> true;
  141:                        (_) -> false
  142:                      end,
  143:                      List),
  144:             "Expected a basename in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  145:             "including baz.hrl in deterministic mode."),
  146:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  147:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{"file.hrl",_Line}}) -> true;
  148:                        (_) -> false
  149:                      end,
  150:                      List),
  151:             "Expected a basename in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  152:             "including file.hrl in deterministic mode."),
  153:     ok.
  154: 
  155: nondeterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  156:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  157:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "deterministic_include.erl"),
  158:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  159:                                        {source_name, "deterministic_include.erl"}]),
  160: 
  161:     %% Outside of deterministic mode, full paths, should be written to
  162:     %% the -file() attributes resulting from -include and -include_lib
  163:     %% to make debugging easier.
  164:     %% We don't try to assume what the full absolute path will be in the
  165:     %% unit test, since that can depend on the environment and how the
  166:     %% test is executed. Instead, we just look for whether there is
  167:     %% the parent directory along with the basename at least.
  168:     IncludeAbsolutePathSuffix = filename:join("include","baz.hrl"),
  169:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  170:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{IncludePath,_Line}}) ->
  171:                          lists:suffix(IncludeAbsolutePathSuffix,IncludePath);
  172:                        (_) -> false
  173:                      end,
  174:                      List),
  175:             "Expected an absolute in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  176:             "including baz.hrl outside of deterministic mode."),
  177:     IncludeLibAbsolutePathSuffix = filename:join("include","file.hrl"),
  178:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  179:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{IncludePath,_line}}) ->
  180:                          lists:suffix(IncludeLibAbsolutePathSuffix,IncludePath);
  181:                        (_) -> false
  182:                      end,
  183:                      List),
  184:             "Expected an absolute in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  185:             "including file.hrl outside of deterministic mode."),
  186:     ok.
  187: 
  188: %%% Here is a little reimplementation of epp:parse_file, which times out
  189: %%% after 4 seconds if the epp server doesn't respond. If we use the
  190: %%% regular epp:parse_file, the test case will time out, and then epp
  191: %%% server will go on growing until we dump core.
  192: epp_parse_file(File, Inc, Predef) ->
  193:     List = do_epp_parse_file(fun() ->
  194: 				     epp:open(File, Inc, Predef)
  195: 			     end),
  196:     List = do_epp_parse_file(fun() ->
  197: 				     Opts = [{name, File},
  198: 					     {includes, Inc},
  199: 					     {macros, Predef}],
  200: 				     epp:open(Opts)
  201: 			     end),
  202:     {ok, List}.
  203: 
  204: do_epp_parse_file(Open) ->
  205:     {ok, Epp} = Open(),
  206:     List = collect_epp_forms(Epp),
  207:     epp:close(Epp),
  208:     List.
  209: 
  210: collect_epp_forms(Epp) ->
  211:     Result = epp_parse_erl_form(Epp),
  212:     case Result of
  213: 	{error, _Error} ->
  214: 	    [Result | collect_epp_forms(Epp)];
  215: 	{ok, Form} ->
  216: 	    [Form | collect_epp_forms(Epp)];
  217: 	{eof, _} ->
  218: 	    [Result]
  219:     end.
  220: 
  221: epp_parse_erl_form(Epp) ->
  222:     P = spawn(?MODULE, epp_parse_erl_form, [Epp, self()]),
  223:     receive
  224: 	{P, Result} ->
  225: 	    Result
  226:     after 4000 ->
  227: 	    exit(Epp, kill),
  228: 	    exit(P, kill),
  229: 	    timeout
  230:     end.
  231: 
  232: epp_parse_erl_form(Epp, Parent) ->
  233:     Parent ! {self(), epp:parse_erl_form(Epp)}.
  234: 
  235: check_errors([]) ->
  236:     ok;
  237: check_errors([{error, Info} | Rest]) ->
  238:     {Line, Mod, Desc} = Info,
  239:     case Line of
  240: 	I when is_integer(I) -> ok;
  241: 	{L,C} when is_integer(L), is_integer(C), C >= 1 -> ok
  242:     end,
  243:     Str = lists:flatten(Mod:format_error(Desc)),
  244:     [Str] = io_lib:format("~s", [Str]),
  245:     check_errors(Rest);
  246: check_errors([_ | Rest]) ->
  247:     check_errors(Rest).
  248: 
  249: 
  250: upcase_mac_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  251:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac2.erl"),
  252:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  253:     [_, {attribute, _, plupp, Tuple} | _] = List,
  254:     Tuple = {1, 1, 3, 3},
  255:     ok.
  256: 
  257: upcase_mac_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  258:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac2.erl"),
  259:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], [{p, 5}, {'P', 6}]),
  260:     [_, {attribute, _, plupp, Tuple} | _] = List,
  261:     Tuple = {5, 5, 6, 6},
  262:     ok.
  263: 
  264: predef_mac(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  265:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac3.erl"),
  266:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  267:     [_,
  268:      {attribute, Anno, l, Line1},
  269:      {attribute, _, f, File},
  270:      {attribute, _, machine1, _},
  271:      {attribute, _, module, mac3},
  272:      {attribute, _, m, mac3},
  273:      {attribute, _, ms, "mac3"},
  274:      {attribute, _, machine2, _}
  275:      | _] = List,
  276:     Line1 = erl_anno:line(Anno),
  277:     ok.
  278: 
  279: variable_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  280:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  281:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "variable_1.erl"),
  282:     true = os:putenv("VAR", DataDir),
  283:     %% variable_1.erl includes variable_1_include.hrl and
  284:     %% variable_1_include_dir.hrl.
  285:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  286:     {value, {attribute,_,a,{value1,value2}}} =
  287: 	lists:keysearch(a,3,List),
  288:     ok.
  289: 
  290: %% undef without module declaration.
  291: otp_4870(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  292:     Ts = [{otp_4870,
  293:            <<"-undef(foo).
  294:            ">>,
  295:            []}],
  296:     [] = check(Config, Ts),
  297:     ok.
  298: 
  299: %% crashing erl_scan
  300: otp_4871(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  301:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  302:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_4871.erl"),
  303:     ok = file:write_file(File, "-module(otp_4871)."),
  304:     %% Testing crash in erl_scan. Unfortunately there currently is
  305:     %% no known way to crash erl_scan so it is emulated by killing the
  306:     %% file io server. This assumes lots of things about how
  307:     %% the processes are started and how monitors are set up,
  308:     %% so there are some sanity checks before killing.
  309:     {ok,Epp} = epp:open(File, []),
  310:     timer:sleep(1),
  311:     true = current_module(Epp, epp),
  312:     {monitored_by,[Io]} = process_info(Epp, monitored_by),
  313:     true = current_module(Io, file_io_server),
  314:     exit(Io, emulate_crash),
  315:     timer:sleep(1),
  316:     {error,{_Line,epp,cannot_parse}} = otp_4871_parse_file(Epp),
  317:     epp:close(Epp),
  318:     ok.
  319: 
  320: current_module(Pid, Mod) ->
  321:     {current_function, {Mod, _, _}} = process_info(Pid, current_function),
  322:     true.
  323: 
  324: otp_4871_parse_file(Epp) ->
  325:     case epp:parse_erl_form(Epp) of
  326: 	{ok,_} -> otp_4871_parse_file(Epp);
  327: 	Other -> Other
  328:     end.
  329: 
  330: %% OTP-5362. The -file attribute is recognized.
  331: otp_5362(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  332:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  333: 
  334:     Copts = [return, strong_validation,{i,Dir}],
  335: 
  336:     File_Incl = filename:join(Dir, "incl_5362.erl"),
  337:     File_Incl2 = filename:join(Dir, "incl2_5362.erl"),
  338:     File_Incl3 = filename:join(Dir, "incl3_5362.erl"),
  339:     Incl = <<"-module(incl_5362).
  340: 
  341:               -include(\"incl2_5362.erl\").
  342: 
  343:               -include_lib(\"incl3_5362.erl\").
  344: 
  345:               hi(There) -> % line 7
  346:                    a.
  347:            ">>,
  348:     Incl2 = <<"-file(\"some.file\", 100).
  349: 
  350:                foo(Bar) -> % line 102
  351:                    foo.
  352:             ">>,
  353:     Incl3 = <<"glurk(Foo) -> % line 1
  354:                   bar.
  355:             ">>,
  356:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl, Incl),
  357:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl2, Incl2),
  358:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl3, Incl3),
  359: 
  360:     {ok, incl_5362, InclWarnings} = compile:file(File_Incl, Copts),
  361:     true = message_compare(
  362:                    [{File_Incl3,[{{1,1},erl_lint,{unused_function,{glurk,1}}},
  363:                                  {{1,7},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Foo'}}]},
  364:                     {File_Incl,[{{7,15},erl_lint,{unused_function,{hi,1}}},
  365:                                 {{7,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'There'}}]},
  366:                     {"some.file",[{{102,16},erl_lint,{unused_function,{foo,1}}},
  367:                                   {{102,20},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Bar'}}]}],
  368:                    lists:usort(InclWarnings)),
  369: 
  370:     file:delete(File_Incl),
  371:     file:delete(File_Incl2),
  372:     file:delete(File_Incl3),
  373: 
  374:     %% A -file attribute referring back to the including file.
  375:     File_Back = filename:join(Dir, "back_5362.erl"),
  376:     File_Back_hrl = filename:join(Dir, "back_5362.hrl"),
  377:     Back = <<"-module(back_5362).
  378: 
  379:               -export([foo/1]).
  380: 
  381:               -file(?FILE, 1).
  382:               -include(\"back_5362.hrl\").
  383: 
  384:               foo(V) -> % line 4
  385:                   bar.
  386:               ">>,
  387:     Back_hrl = [<<"
  388:                   -file(\"">>,File_Back,<<"\", 2).
  389:                  ">>],
  390: 
  391:     ok = file:write_file(File_Back, Back),
  392:     ok = file:write_file(File_Back_hrl, list_to_binary(Back_hrl)),
  393: 
  394:     {ok, back_5362, BackWarnings} = compile:file(File_Back, Copts),
  395:     true = message_compare(
  396:                    [{File_Back,[{{4,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'V'}}]}],
  397:                    BackWarnings),
  398:     file:delete(File_Back),
  399:     file:delete(File_Back_hrl),
  400: 
  401:     %% Set filename but keep line.
  402:     File_Change = filename:join(Dir, "change_5362.erl"),
  403:     Change = [<<"-module(change_5362).
  404: 
  405:                 -file(?FILE, 100).
  406: 
  407:                 -export([foo/1,bar/1]).
  408: 
  409:                 -file(\"other.file\", ?LINE). % like an included file...
  410:                 foo(A) -> % line 105
  411:                     bar.
  412: 
  413:                 -file(\"">>,File_Change,<<"\", 1000).
  414: 
  415:                 bar(B) -> % line 1002
  416:                     foo.
  417:               ">>],
  418: 
  419:     ok = file:write_file(File_Change, list_to_binary(Change)),
  420: 
  421:     {ok, change_5362, ChangeWarnings} =
  422:         compile:file(File_Change, Copts),
  423:     true = message_compare(
  424:                    [{File_Change,[{{1002,21},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}}]},
  425:                     {"other.file",[{{105,21},erl_lint,{unused_var,'A'}}]}],
  426:                    lists:usort(ChangeWarnings)),
  427: 
  428:     file:delete(File_Change),
  429: 
  430:     %% -file attribute ending with a blank (not a newline).
  431:     File_Blank = filename:join(Dir, "blank_5362.erl"),
  432: 
  433:     Blank = <<"-module(blank_5362).
  434: 
  435:                -export([q/1,a/1,b/1,c/1]).
  436: 
  437:                -
  438:                file(?FILE, 18). q(Q) -> foo. % line 18
  439: 
  440:                a(A) -> % line 20
  441:                    1.
  442: 
  443:                -file(?FILE, 42).
  444: 
  445:                b(B) -> % line 44
  446:                    2.
  447: 
  448:                -file(?FILE, ?LINE). c(C) -> % line 47
  449:                    3.
  450:             ">>,
  451:     ok = file:write_file(File_Blank, Blank),
  452:     {ok, blank_5362, BlankWarnings} = compile:file(File_Blank, Copts),
  453:     true = message_compare(
  454:              [{File_Blank,[{{18,3},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Q'}},
  455:                            {{20,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'A'}},
  456:                            {{44,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  457:                            {{47,3},erl_lint,{unused_var,'C'}}]}],
  458:               lists:usort(BlankWarnings)),
  459:     file:delete(File_Blank),
  460: 
  461:     %% __FILE__ is set by inclusion and by -file attribute
  462:     FILE_incl = filename:join(Dir, "file_5362.erl"),
  463:     FILE_incl1 = filename:join(Dir, "file_incl_5362.erl"),
  464:     FILE = <<"-module(file_5362).
  465: 
  466:               -export([ff/0, ii/0]).
  467: 
  468:               -include(\"file_incl_5362.erl\").
  469: 
  470:               -file(\"other_file\", 100).
  471: 
  472:               ff() ->
  473:                   ?FILE.">>,
  474:     FILE1 = <<"ii() -> ?FILE.
  475:               ">>,
  476:     FILE_Mod = file_5362,
  477:     ok = file:write_file(FILE_incl, FILE),
  478:     ok = file:write_file(FILE_incl1, FILE1),
  479:     FILE_Copts = [return, {i,Dir},{outdir,Dir}],
  480:     {ok, file_5362, []} = compile:file(FILE_incl, FILE_Copts),
  481:     AbsFile = filename:rootname(FILE_incl, ".erl"),
  482:     {module, FILE_Mod} = code:load_abs(AbsFile, FILE_Mod),
  483:     II = FILE_Mod:ii(),
  484:     "file_incl_5362.erl" = filename:basename(II),
  485:     FF = FILE_Mod:ff(),
  486:     "other_file" = filename:basename(FF),
  487:     code:purge(file_5362),
  488: 
  489:     file:delete(FILE_incl),
  490:     file:delete(FILE_incl1),
  491: 
  492:     ok.
  493: 
  494: pmod(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  495:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  496:     Pmod = filename:join(DataDir, "pmod.erl"),
  497:     case epp:parse_file([Pmod], [], []) of
  498: 	      {ok,Forms} ->
  499: 		  %% io:format("~p\n", [Forms]),
  500: 		  [] = [F || {error,_}=F <- Forms],
  501: 		  ok
  502: 	  end,
  503:     ok.
  504: 
  505: not_circular(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  506:     %% Used to generate a compilation error, wrongly saying that it
  507:     %% was a circular definition.
  508: 
  509:     Ts = [{circular_1,
  510:            <<"-define(S(S), ??S).\n"
  511:              "t() -> \"string\" = ?S(string), ok.\n">>,
  512:            ok}],
  513:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  514:     ok.
  515: 
  516: %% Skip some bytes in the beginning of the file.
  517: skip_header(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  518:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  519:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "epp_test_skip_header.erl"]),
  520:     ok = file:write_file(File,
  521: 			       <<"some bytes
  522:                                   in the beginning of the file
  523:                                   that should be skipped
  524:                                   -module(epp_test_skip_header).
  525:                                   -export([main/1]).
  526: 
  527:                                   main(_) -> ?MODULE.
  528: 
  529:                                   ">>),
  530:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
  531:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  532:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  533:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  534:     {ok, Epp} = epp:open([{fd, Fd}, {name, list_to_atom(File)}, {location, 4}]),
  535: 
  536:     Forms = epp:parse_file(Epp),
  537:     [] = [Reason || {error, Reason} <- Forms],
  538:     ok = epp:close(Epp),
  539:     ok = file:close(Fd),
  540: 
  541:     ok.
  542: 
  543: %% ?MODULE before module declaration.
  544: otp_6277(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  545:     Ts = [{otp_6277,
  546:            <<"-undef(ASSERT).
  547:               -define(ASSERT, ?MODULE).
  548: 
  549:               ?ASSERT().">>,
  550:            [{error,{4,epp,{undefined,'MODULE', none}}}]}],
  551:     [] = check(Config, Ts),
  552:     ok.
  553: 
  554: %% Test -ifdef(MODULE) before module declaration. Should not be
  555: %% considered defined.
  556: gh_4995(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  557:     Ts = [{gh_4995,
  558:            <<"-ifdef(MODULE).
  559:               -record(r, {x = ?MODULE}).
  560:               -endif.">>,
  561:            []}],
  562:     [] = check(Config, Ts),
  563:     ok.
  564:

  566: otp_7702(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  567:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  568:     File = filename:join(Dir, "file_7702.erl"),
  569:     Contents = <<"-module(file_7702).
  570: 
  571:                   -export([t/0]).
  572: 
  573:                   -define(RECEIVE(Msg,Body),
  574:                        receive
  575:                            Msg -> Body;
  576:                            M ->
  577:                 exit({unexpected_message,M,on_line,?LINE,was_expecting,??Msg})
  578:                        after 10000 ->
  579:                             exit({timeout,on_line,?LINE,was_expecting,??Msg})
  580:                        end).
  581:                    t() ->
  582:                        ?RECEIVE(foo, bar).">>,
  583:     ok = file:write_file(File, Contents),
  584:     {ok, file_7702, []} =
  585:         compile:file(File, [debug_info,return,{outdir,Dir}]),
  586: 
  587:     BeamFile = filename:join(Dir, "file_7702.beam"),
  588:     {ok, AC} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [abstract_code]),
  589: 
  590:     {file_7702,[{abstract_code,{_,Forms}}]} = AC,
  591:     Forms2 = unopaque_forms(Forms),
  592:         [{attribute,{1,1},file,_},
  593:          _,
  594:          _,

  598:               [_,

  600:                 [{var,{14,38},'M'}],
  601:                 [],
  602:                 [{_,_,_,
  603:                   [{tuple,{14,38},
  604:                     [{atom,{14,38},unexpected_message},

  607:                      {integer,{14,38},14},

  609:                      {string,{14,38},"foo"}]}]}]}],
  610:               {integer,{14,38},10000},

  612:                 {atom,{14,38},exit},

  864:             [{error,{2,epp,{depth,"include_lib"}}}]},

  868:             [{error,{2,epp,{depth,"include"}}}]}

  873:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_8130.erl"),
  874:     ok = file:write_file(File,
  875:                                "-module(otp_8130).\n"
  876:                                "-define(a, 3.14).\n"
  877:                                "t() -> ?a.\n"),
  878:     {ok,Epp} = epp:open(File, []),
  879:     PreDefMacs = macs(Epp),
  880:     ['BASE_MODULE','BASE_MODULE_STRING','BEAM',
  881:      'FEATURE_AVAILABLE', 'FEATURE_ENABLED','FILE',
  882:      'FUNCTION_ARITY','FUNCTION_NAME',
  883:      'LINE','MACHINE','MODULE','MODULE_STRING',
  884:      'OTP_RELEASE'] = PreDefMacs,
  885:     {ok,[{'-',_},{atom,_,file}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  886:     {ok,[{'-',_},{atom,_,module}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  887:     {ok,[{atom,_,t}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  888:     {eof,_} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  889:     [a] = macs(Epp) -- PreDefMacs,
  890:     epp:close(Epp),
  891: 
  892:     %% escript
  893:     ModuleStr = "any_name",
  894:     Module = list_to_atom(ModuleStr),
  895:     fun() ->
  896:             PreDefMacros = [{'MODULE', Module, redefine},
  897:                             {'MODULE_STRING', ModuleStr, redefine},
  898:                             a, {b,2}],
  899:             {ok,Epp2} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros),
  900:             [{atom,_,true}] = macro(Epp2, a),
  901:             [{integer,_,2}] = macro(Epp2, b),
  902:             false = macro(Epp2, c),
  903:             epp:close(Epp2)
  904:     end(),
  905:     fun() ->
  906:             PreDefMacros = [{a,b,c}],
  907:             {error,{bad,{a,b,c}}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  908:     end(),
  909:     fun() ->
  910:             PreDefMacros = [a, {a,1}],
  911:             {error,{redefine,a}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  912:     end(),
  913:     fun() ->
  914:             PreDefMacros = [{a,1},a],
  915:             {error,{redefine,a}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  916:     end(),
  917: 
  918:     {error,enoent} = epp:open("no such file", []),
  919:     {error,enoent} = epp:parse_file("no such file", [], []),
  920: 
  921:     _ = ifdef(Config),
  922: 
  923:     ok.
  924: 
  925: scan_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  926:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  927:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "source_name.erl"),
  928: 
  929:     {ok, Toks, [{encoding, _}]} = epp:scan_file(File, []),
  930:     [FileForm1, ModuleForm, ExportForm,
  931:      FileForm2, FileForm3, FunctionForm,
  932:      {eof,_}] = Toks,
  933:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ] = FileForm1,
  934:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,module}, {'(',_} | _ ] = ModuleForm,
  935:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,export}, {'(',_} | _ ] = ExportForm,
  936:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ] = FileForm2,
  937:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ] = FileForm3,
  938:     ok.
  939: 
  940: macs(Epp) ->
  941:     Macros = epp:macro_defs(Epp), % not documented
  942:     lists:sort([MName || {{atom,MName},_} <- Macros]).
  943: 
  944: macro(Epp, N) ->
  945:     case lists:keyfind({atom,N}, 1, epp:macro_defs(Epp)) of
  946:         false -> false;
  947:         {{atom,N},{_,V}} -> V;
  948:         {{atom,N},Defs} -> lists:append([V || {_,{_,V}} <- Defs])
  949:     end.
  950: 
  951: ifdef(Config) ->
  952:     Cs = [{ifdef_c1,
  953:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
  954:              "a bug.\n"
  955:              "-else.\n"
  956:              "-ifdef(A).\n"
  957:              "a bug.\n"
  958:              "-endif.\n"
  959:              "-else.\n"
  960:              "t() -> ok.\n"
  961:              "-endif.">>,
  962:            {errors,[{{7,2},epp,{illegal,"repeated",'else'}}],[]}},
  963: 
  964:           {ifdef_c2,
  965:            <<"-define(a, true).\n"
  966:              "-ifdef(a).\n"
  967:              "a bug.\n"
  968:              "-endif.">>,
  969:            {errors,[{{3,3},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","bug"]}],[]}},
  970: 
  971:           {ifdef_c3,
  972:            <<"-define(a, true).\n"
  973:              "-ifdef(a).\n"
  974:              "-endif">>,
  975: 
  976:            {errors,[{{3,2},epp,{bad,endif}},
  977:                     {{3,7},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",ifdef}}],
  978:           []}},
  979: 
  980:           {ifdef_c4,
  981:            <<"\n-ifdef a.\n"
  982:              "-endif.\n">>,
  983:            {errors,[{{2,8},epp,{bad,ifdef}}],[]}},
  984: 
  985:           {ifdef_c5,
  986:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
  987:              "-else.\n"
  988:              "-endif.\n"
  989:              "-endif.\n">>,
  990:            {errors,[{{4,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",endif}}],[]}},
  991: 
  992:           {ifdef_c6,
  993:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
  994:              "-else.\n"
  995:              "-endif.\n"
  996:              "-else.\n">>,
  997:            {errors,[{{4,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'else'}}],[]}},
  998: 
  999:           {ifdef_c7,
 1000:            <<"-ifndef(a).\n"
 1001:              "-else\n"
 1002:              "foo bar\n"
 1003:              "-else.\n"
 1004:              "t() -> a.\n"
 1005:              "-endif.\n">>,
 1006:            {errors,[{{3,1},epp,{bad,'else'}}],[]}},
 1007: 
 1008:           {ifdef_c8,
 1009:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1010:               "-foo bar.">>,
 1011:            {errors,[{{2,10},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",ifdef}}],[]}},
 1012: 
 1013:           {ifdef_c9,
 1014:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1015:               "3.3e12000.\n"
 1016:               "-endif.\n">>,
 1017:            []},
 1018: 
 1019:           {ifdef_c10,
 1020:            <<"\nt() -> 3.3e12000.\n">>,
 1021:            {errors,[{{2,8},erl_scan,{illegal,float}},
 1022:                     {{2,17},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","'.'"]}], % ...
 1023:             []}},
 1024: 
 1025:           {ifndef_c1,
 1026:            <<"-ifndef(a).\n"
 1027:              "-ifndef(A).\n"
 1028:              "t() -> ok.\n"
 1029:              "-endif.\n"
 1030:              "-else.\n"
 1031:              "a bug.\n"
 1032:              "-else.\n"
 1033:              "a bug.\n"
 1034:              "-endif.">>,
 1035:            {errors,[{{7,2},epp,{illegal,"repeated",'else'}}],[]}},
 1036: 
 1037:           {ifndef_c3,
 1038:            <<"-ifndef(a).\n"
 1039:              "-endif">>,
 1040: 
 1041:            {errors,[{{2,2},epp,{bad,endif}},
 1042:                     {{2,7},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",ifndef}}],
 1043:           []}},
 1044: 
 1045:           {ifndef_c4,
 1046:            <<"\n-ifndef a.\n"
 1047:              "-endif.\n">>,
 1048:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{bad,ifndef}}],[]}},
 1049: 
 1050:           {define_c5,
 1051:            <<"-\ndefine a.\n">>,
 1052:            {errors,[{{2,8},epp,{bad,define}}],[]}}
 1053:           ],
 1054:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1055: 
 1056:     Ts =  [{ifdef_1,
 1057:             <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1058:               "a bug.\n"
 1059:               "-else.\n"
 1060:               "-ifdef(A).\n"
 1061:               "a bug.\n"
 1062:               "-endif.\n"
 1063:               "t() -> ok.\n"
 1064:               "-endif.">>,
 1065:            ok},

 1071:               "-ifdef(A).\n"
 1072:               "t() -> ok.\n"
 1073:               "-else.\n"
 1074:               "a bug.\n"
 1075:               "-endif.\n"
 1076:               "-else.\n"
 1077:               "a bug.\n"
 1078:               "-endif.">>,
 1079:            ok},
 1080: 
 1081:            {ifdef_3,
 1082:             <<"\n-define(a, true).\n"
 1083:               "-ifndef(a).\n"

 1086:               "-define(A, true).\n"

 1138: test_error(Config) ->
 1139:     Cs = [{error_c1,
 1140:            <<"-error(\"string and macro: \" ?MODULE_STRING).\n"
 1141: 	     "-ifdef(NOT_DEFINED).\n"
 1142: 	     " -error(\"this one will be skipped\").\n"
 1143: 	     "-endif.\n">>,

 1148: 	     " t() -> a.\n"
 1149: 	     "-else.\n"
 1150: 	     "-ifdef(CONFIG_B).\n"
 1151: 	     " t() -> b.\n"
 1152: 	     "-else.\n"
 1153: 	     "-error(\"Neither CONFIG_A nor CONFIG_B are available\").\n"
 1154: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1155: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1156: 	   {errors,[{{7,2},epp,{error,"Neither CONFIG_A nor CONFIG_B are available"}}],[]}},

 1160: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,error}}],[]}}

 1197: %% OTP-12847: Test the -if and -elif directives and the built-in
 1198: %% function defined(Symbol).
 1199: test_if(Config) ->
 1200:     Cs = [{if_1c,
 1201: 	   <<"-if.\n"
 1202: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1203: 	     "-if no_parentheses.\n"
 1204: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1205: 	     "-if(syntax error.\n"
 1206: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1207: 	     "-if(true).\n"
 1208: 	     "-if(a+3).\n"
 1209: 	     "syntax error not triggered here.\n"
 1210: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1211:            {errors,[{{1,23},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1212: 		    {{3,5},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1213: 		    {{5,12},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","error"]},
 1214: 		    {{11,1},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",'if'}}],
 1215: 	    []}},
 1216: 
 1217: 	  {if_2c,			       	%Bad guard expressions.
 1218: 	   <<"-if(is_list(integer_to_list(42))).\n" %Not guard BIF.
 1219: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1220: 	     "-if(begin true end).\n"
 1221: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1222: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1223: 		    {{3,2},epp,{bad,'if'}}],
 1224: 	    []}},
 1225: 
 1226: 	  {if_3c,			       	%Invalid use of defined/1.
 1227: 	   <<"-if defined(42).\n"
 1228: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1229: 	   {errors,[{{1,24},epp,{bad,'if'}}],[]}},
 1230: 
 1231: 	  {if_4c,
 1232: 	   <<"-elif OTP_RELEASE > 18.\n">>,
 1233: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'elif'}}],[]}},
 1234: 
 1235: 	  {if_5c,
 1236: 	   <<"-ifdef(not_defined_today).\n"
 1237: 	     "-else.\n"
 1238: 	     "-elif OTP_RELEASE > 18.\n"
 1239: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1240: 	   {errors,[{{3,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'elif'}}],[]}},
 1241: 
 1242: 	  {if_6c,
 1243: 	   <<"-if(defined(OTP_RELEASE)).\n"
 1244: 	     "-else.\n"
 1245: 	     "-elif(true).\n"
 1246: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1247: 	   {errors,[{{3,2},epp,elif_after_else}],[]}},
 1248: 
 1249: 	  {if_7c,
 1250: 	   <<"-if(begin true end).\n"		%Not a guard expression.
 1251: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1252: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,'if'}}],[]}},
 1253: 
 1254: 	  {if_8c,
 1255: 	   <<"-if(?foo).\n"                     %Undefined symbol.
 1256: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1257: 	   {errors,[{{1,25},epp,{undefined,foo,none}}],[]}},
 1258: 
 1259: 	  {if_9c,
 1260: 	   <<"-if(not_builtin()).\n"
 1261: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1262: 	     "-else.\n"
 1263: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1264: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1265: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,'if'}}],[]}}
 1266: 	 ],
 1267:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1268: 
 1269:     Ts = [{if_1,
 1270: 	   <<"-if(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1271: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1272: 	     "-else.\n"
 1273: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1274: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1275:            ok},
 1276: 
 1277: 	  {if_2,
 1278: 	   <<"-if(false).\n"
 1279: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1280: 	     "-elif(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1281: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1282: 	     "-else.\n"
 1283: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1284: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1285:            ok},
 1286:

 1288: 	   <<"-if(true).\n"
 1289: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1290: 	     "-elif(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1291: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1292: 	     "-else.\n"
 1293: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1294: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1295:            ok},

 1299: 	     "-if(defined(a) andalso defined(OTP_RELEASE)).\n"
 1300: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1301: 	     "-else.\n"
 1302: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1303: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1304:            ok},

 1342: %% Advanced test on overloading macros.
 1343: overload_mac(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1344:     Cs = [
 1345:           %% '-undef' removes all definitions of a macro
 1346:           {overload_mac_c1,
 1347:            <<"-define(A, a).\n"
 1348:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1349:             "-undef(A).\n"
 1350:             "t1() -> ?A.\n",
 1351:             "t2() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1352:            {errors,[{{4,10},epp,{undefined,'A', none}},
 1353:                     {{5,10},epp,{undefined,'A', 1}}],[]}},
 1354: 
 1355:           %% cannot overload predefined macros
 1356:           {overload_mac_c2,
 1357:            <<"\n-define(MODULE(X), X).">>,
 1358:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine_predef,'MODULE'}}],[]}},
 1359: 
 1360:           %% cannot overload macros with same arity
 1361:           {overload_mac_c3,
 1362:            <<"-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1363:             "-define(A(Y), Y).">>,
 1364:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine,'A'}}],[]}},
 1365: 
 1366:           {overload_mac_c4,
 1367:            <<"-define(A, a).\n"
 1368:             "-define(A(X,Y), {X,Y}).\n"
 1369:             "a(X) -> X.\n"
 1370:             "t() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1371:            {errors,[{{4,9},epp,{mismatch,'A'}}],[]}}
 1372:          ],
 1373:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1374: 
 1375:     Ts = [
 1376:           {overload_mac_r1,
 1377:            <<"-define(A, 1).\n"
 1378:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1379:             "-define(A(X, Y), {X, Y}).\n"
 1380:             "t() -> {?A, ?A(2), ?A(3, 4)}.">>,
 1381:            {1, 2, {3, 4}}},
 1382: 
 1383:           {overload_mac_r2,
 1384:            <<"-define(A, 1).\n"
 1385:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1386:             "t() -> ?A(?A).">>,
 1387:            1},
 1388: 
 1389:           {overload_mac_r3,
 1390:            <<"-define(A, ?B).\n"
 1391:             "-define(B, a).\n"
 1392:             "-define(B(X), {b,X}).\n"
 1393:             "a(X) -> X.\n"
 1394:             "t() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1395:            1}
 1396:           ],
 1397:     [] = run(Config, Ts).
 1398:

 1400: %% OTP-8388. More tests on overloaded macros.
 1401: otp_8388(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1402:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1403:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_8388.erl"),
 1404:     ok = file:write_file(File, <<"-module(otp_8388)."
 1405:                                        "-define(LINE, a).">>),
 1406:     fun() ->
 1407:             PreDefMacros = [{'LINE', a}],
 1408:             {error,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}} =
 1409:                 epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
 1410:     end(),
 1411: 
 1412:     fun() ->
 1413:             PreDefMacros = ['LINE'],
 1414:             {error,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}} =
 1415:                 epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
 1416:     end(),
 1417: 
 1418:     Ts = [
 1419:           {macro_1,
 1420:            <<"-define(m(A), A).\n"
 1421:              "t() -> ?m(,).\n">>,
 1422:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{arg_error,m}}],[]}},
 1423:           {macro_2,
 1424:            <<"-define(m(A), A).\n"
 1425:              "t() -> ?m(a,).\n">>,
 1426:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{arg_error,m}}],[]}},
 1427:           {macro_3,
 1428:            <<"\n-define(LINE, a).\n">>,
 1429:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}}],[]}},
 1430:           {macro_4,
 1431:            <<"-define(A(B, C, D), {B,C,D}).\n"
 1432:              "t() -> ?A(a,,3).\n">>,
 1433:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{mismatch,'A'}}],[]}},
 1434:           {macro_5,
 1435:            <<"-define(Q, {?F0(), ?F1(,,4)}).\n">>,
 1436:            {errors,[{{1,40},epp,{arg_error,'F1'}}],[]}},
 1437:           {macro_6,
 1438:            <<"-define(FOO(X), ?BAR(X)).\n"
 1439:              "-define(BAR(X), ?FOO(X)).\n"
 1440:              "-undef(FOO).\n"
 1441:              "test() -> ?BAR(1).\n">>,
 1442:            {errors,[{{4,12},epp,{undefined,'FOO',1}}],[]}}
 1443:          ],
 1444:     [] = compile(Config, Ts),
 1445:     ok.

 1470: %% OTP-8911. -file and file inclusion bug.
 1471: otp_8911(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1472:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 1473: 	true ->
 1474: 	    {skip, "Testing cover, so cannot run when cover is already running"};
 1475: 	false ->
 1476: 	    do_otp_8911(Config)
 1477:     end.
 1478: do_otp_8911(Config) ->
 1479:     {ok, CWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 1480:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1481: 
 1482:     File = "i.erl",
 1483:     Cont = <<"-module(i).
 1484:               -export([t/0]).
 1485:               -file(\"fil1\", 100).
 1486:               -include(\"i1.erl\").
 1487:               t() ->
 1488:                   a.
 1489:            ">>,
 1490:     ok = file:write_file(File, Cont),
 1491:     Incl = <<"-file(\"fil2\", 35).
 1492:               t1() ->
 1493:                   b.
 1494:            ">>,
 1495:     File1 = "i1.erl",
 1496:     ok = file:write_file(File1, Incl),
 1497: 
 1498:     {ok, i} = cover:compile(File),
 1499:     a = i:t(),
 1500:     {ok,[{{i,6},1}]} = cover:analyse(i, calls, line),
 1501:     cover:stop(),
 1502: 
 1503:     file:delete(File),
 1504:     file:delete(File1),
 1505:     file:set_cwd(CWD),
 1506:     ok.
 1507:

 1516: 
 1517: %% OTP-10302. Unicode characters scanner/parser.
 1518: otp_10302(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1519:     %% Two messages (one too many). Keeps otp_4871 happy.
 1520:     Cs = [{otp_10302,
 1521:            <<"%% coding: utf-8\n \n \x{E4}">>,
 1522:            {errors,[{{3,1},epp,cannot_parse},
 1523:                     {{3,1},file_io_server,invalid_unicode}],[]}}
 1524:          ],
 1525:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1526:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1527:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_10302.erl"),
 1528:     utf8 = encoding("coding: utf-8", File),
 1529:     utf8 = encoding("coding: UTF-8", File),
 1530:     latin1 = encoding("coding: Latin-1", File),
 1531:     latin1 = encoding("coding: latin-1", File),
 1532:     none = encoding_com("coding: utf-8", File),
 1533:     none = encoding_com("\n\n%% coding: utf-8", File),
 1534:     none = encoding_nocom("\n\n coding: utf-8", File),
 1535:     utf8 = encoding_com("\n%% coding: utf-8", File),
 1536:     utf8 = encoding_nocom("\n coding: utf-8", File),
 1537:     none = encoding("coding: \nutf-8", File),
 1538:     latin1 = encoding("Encoding :  latin-1", File),
 1539:     utf8 = encoding("ccoding: UTF-8", File),
 1540:     utf8 = encoding("coding= utf-8", File),
 1541:     utf8 = encoding_com(" %% coding= utf-8", File),
 1542:     utf8 = encoding("coding  =  utf-8", File),
 1543:     none = encoding("coding: utf-16 coding: utf-8", File), %first is bad
 1544:     none = encoding("Coding: utf-8", File),    %capital c
 1545:     utf8 = encoding("-*- coding: utf-8 -*-", File),
 1546:     utf8 = encoding("-*-coding= utf-8-*-", File),
 1547:     utf8 = encoding("codingcoding= utf-8", File),
 1548:     ok = prefix("coding: utf-8", File, utf8),
 1549: 
 1550:     "coding: latin-1" = epp:encoding_to_string(latin1),
 1551:     "coding: utf-8" = epp:encoding_to_string(utf8),
 1552:     true = lists:member(epp:default_encoding(), [latin1, utf8]),
 1553: 
 1554:     ok.
 1555: 
 1556: prefix(S, File, Enc) ->
 1557:     prefix(0, S, File, Enc).
 1558: 
 1559: prefix(100, _S, _File, _) ->
 1560:     ok;
 1561: prefix(N, S, File, Enc) ->
 1562:     Enc = encoding(lists:duplicate(N, $\s) ++ S, File),
 1563:     prefix(N+1, S, File, Enc).
 1564: 
 1565: encoding(Enc, File) ->
 1566:     E = encoding_com("%% " ++ Enc, File),
 1567:     none = encoding_com(Enc, File),
 1568:     E = encoding_nocom(Enc, File).
 1569: 
 1570: encoding_com(Enc, File) ->
 1571:     B = list_to_binary(Enc),
 1572:     E = epp:read_encoding_from_binary(B),
 1573:     ok = file:write_file(File, Enc),
 1574:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
 1575:     E = epp:set_encoding(Fd),
 1576:     ok = file:close(Fd),
 1577:     E = epp:read_encoding(File).
 1578: 
 1579: encoding_nocom(Enc, File) ->
 1580:     Options = [{in_comment_only, false}],
 1581:     B = list_to_binary(Enc),
 1582:     E = epp:read_encoding_from_binary(B, Options),
 1583:     ok = file:write_file(File, Enc),
 1584:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
 1585:     ok = file:close(Fd),
 1586:     E = epp:read_encoding(File, Options).
 1587: 
 1588: %% OTP-10820. Unicode filenames.
 1589: otp_10820(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1590:     L = [915,953,959,973,957,953,954,959,957,964],
 1591:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1592:     File = filename:join(Dir, L++".erl"),
 1593:     C1 = <<"%% coding: utf-8\n -module(any).">>,
 1594:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C1, ["+pc", "latin1"]),
 1595:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C1, ["+pc", "unicode"]),
 1596:     C2 = <<"\n-module(any).">>,
 1597:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C2, ["+pc", "latin1"]),
 1598:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C2, ["+pc", "unicode"]).
 1599: 
 1600: do_otp_10820(File, C, PC) ->
 1601:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+fnu"] ++ PC),
 1602:     ok = rpc:call(Node, file, write_file, [File, C]),
 1603:     {ok, Forms} = rpc:call(Node, epp, parse_file, [File, [],[]]),
 1604:     [{attribute,1,file,{File,1}},
 1605:      {attribute,2,module,any},
 1606:      {eof,2}] = unopaque_forms(Forms),
 1607:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1608:     ok.
 1609: 
 1610: %% OTP_14285: Unicode atoms.
 1611: otp_14285(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1612:     %% This is just a sample of errors.
 1613:     Cs = [{otp_14285,
 1614:            <<"-export([f/0]).
 1615:               -define('a\x{400}b', 'a\x{400}d').
 1616:               f() ->
 1617:                   ?'a\x{400}b'.
 1618:               g() ->
 1619:                   ?\"a\x{400}b\".
 1620:               h() ->
 1621:                   ?'a\x{400}no'().
 1622:               "/utf8>>,
 1623:            {errors,[{{6,20},epp,{call,[63,[91,["97",44,"1024",44,"98"],93]]}},
 1624:                     {{8,20},epp,{undefined,'a\x{400}no',0}}],
 1625:             []}}
 1626:          ],
 1627:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1628:     ok.

 1630: %% OTP-11728. Bugfix circular macro.
 1631: otp_11728(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1632:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1633:     H = <<"-define(MACRO,[[]++?MACRO]).">>,
 1634:     HrlFile = filename:join(Dir, "otp_11728.hrl"),
 1635:     ok = file:write_file(HrlFile, H),
 1636:     C = <<"-module(otp_11728).
 1637:            -export([function_name/0]).
 1638: 
 1639:            -include(\"otp_11728.hrl\").
 1640: 
 1641:            function_name()->
 1642:                A=?MACRO, % line 7
 1643:                ok">>,
 1644:     ErlFile = filename:join(Dir, "otp_11728.erl"),
 1645:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C),
 1646:     {ok, L} = epp:parse_file(ErlFile, [Dir], []),
 1647:     true = lists:member({error,{7,epp,{circular,'MACRO',none}}}, L),
 1648:     _ = file:delete(HrlFile),
 1649:     _ = file:delete(ErlFile),
 1650:     ok.

 1652: %% Check the new API for setting the default encoding.
 1653: encoding(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1654:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1655:     ErlFile = filename:join(Dir, "encoding.erl"),
 1656: 
 1657:     %% Try a latin-1 file with no encoding given.
 1658:     C1 = <<"-module(encoding).
 1659:            %% ",246,"
 1660: 	  ">>,
 1661:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C1),
 1662:     {ok,[{attribute,{1,1},file,_},
 1663: 	 {attribute,{1,2},module,encoding},
 1664: 	 {error,_},
 1665: 	 {error,{{2,12},epp,cannot_parse}},
 1666: 	 {eof,{2,12}}]} = epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{location, {1,1}}]),
 1667:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1668: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1669: 	 {eof,3}]} =
 1670: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1}]),
 1671:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1672: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1673: 	 {eof,3}],Extra0} =
 1674: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1},extra]),
 1675:     none = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra0),
 1676: 
 1677:     %% Try a latin-1 file with encoding given in a comment.
 1678:     C2 = <<"-module(encoding).
 1679:            %% encoding: latin-1
 1680:            %% ",246,"
 1681: 	  ">>,
 1682:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C2),
 1683:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1684: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1685: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1686: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, []),
 1687:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1688: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1689: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1690: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1}]),
 1691:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1692: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1693: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1694: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,utf8}]),
 1695:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1696: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1697: 	 {eof,4}],Extra1} =
 1698: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [extra]),
 1699:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra1),
 1700: 
 1701:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1702: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1703: 	 {eof,4}],Extra2} =
 1704: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1},extra]),
 1705:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra2),
 1706:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1707: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1708: 	 {eof,4}],Extra3} =
 1709: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,utf8},extra]),
 1710:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra3),
 1711:     ok.

 1752: 	   {errors,[{{1,24},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","')'"]},

 1766: 
 1767:     Ts = [{f_1,
 1768: 	   <<"t() -> {a,0} = a(), {b,1} = b(1), {c,2} = c(1, 2),\n"
 1769: 	     "  {d,1} = d({d,1}), {foo,1} = foo(foo), ok.\n"
 1770: 	     "a() -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n"
 1771: 	     "b(_) -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n"
 1772: 	     "c(_, (_)) -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n"
 1773: 	     "d({?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}=F) -> F.\n"
 1774: 	     "-define(FOO, foo).\n"
 1775: 	     "?FOO(?FOO) -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n">>,
 1776: 	   ok},
 1777: 
 1778: 	  {f_2,
 1779: 	   <<"t() ->\n"
 1780:              "  A = {a,[<<0:24>>,#{a=>1,b=>2}]},\n"
 1781: 	     "  1 = a(A),\n"
 1782: 	     "  ok.\n"
 1783: 	     "a({a,[<<_,_,_>>,#{a:=1,b:=2}]}) -> ?FUNCTION_ARITY.\n">>,
 1784: 	   ok},
 1785: 
 1786: 	  {f_3,
 1787: 	   <<"-define(FS,\n"
 1788: 	     " atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ \"/\" ++\n"
 1789: 	     " integer_to_list(?FUNCTION_ARITY)).\n"
 1790: 	     "t() ->\n"
 1791: 	     "  {t,0} = {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY},\n"
 1792: 	     "  \"t/0\" = ?FS,\n"
 1793: 	     "  ok.\n">>,
 1794: 	   ok},
 1795: 
 1796: 	  {f_4,
 1797: 	   <<"-define(__, _, _).\n"
 1798: 	     "-define(FF, ?FUNCTION_NAME, ?FUNCTION_ARITY).\n"
 1799: 	     "a(?__) -> 2 = ?FUNCTION_ARITY.\n"
 1800: 	     "b(?FUNCTION_ARITY, ?__) -> ok.\n"
 1801: 	     "c(?FF) -> ok.\n"
 1802: 	     "t() -> a(1, 2), b(3, 1, 2), c(c, 2), ok.\n">>,
 1803: 	   ok}
 1804: 	 ],
 1805:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 1806: 
 1807:     ok.

 1809: source_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1810:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1811:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "source_name.erl"),
 1812: 
 1813:     source_name_1(File, "/test/gurka.erl"),
 1814:     source_name_1(File, "gaffel.erl"),
 1815: 
 1816:     ok.
 1817: 
 1818: source_name_1(File, Expected) ->
 1819:     Res = epp:parse_file(File, [{source_name, Expected}]),
 1820:     {ok, [{attribute,_,file,{Expected,_}} | _Forms]} = Res.
 1821:

 1829:            P,

 1834:     ok.

 2056: 
 2057: %% Start location is 1.
 2058: check(Config, Tests) ->
 2059:     eval_tests(Config, fun check_test/3, Tests).
 2060: 
 2061: %% Start location is {1,1}.
 2062: compile(Config, Tests) ->
 2063:     eval_tests(Config, fun compile_test/3, Tests).
 2064: 
 2065: run(Config, Tests) ->
 2066:     eval_tests(Config, fun run_test/3, Tests).
 2067: 
 2068: eval_tests(Config, Fun, Tests) ->
 2069:     TestsWithOpts =
 2070:         [case Test of
 2071:              {N,P,E} ->
 2072:                  {N,P,[],E};
 2073:              {_,_,_,_} ->
 2074:                  Test
 2075:          end || Test <- Tests],
 2076:     F = fun({N,P,Opts,E}, BadL) ->
 2077:                 %% io:format("Testing ~p~n", [P]),
 2078:                 Return = Fun(Config, P, Opts),
 2079:                 %% The result should be the same when enabling maybe ... end
 2080:                 %% (making 'else' a keyword instead of an atom).
 2081:                 Return = Fun(Config, P, [{feature,maybe_expr,enable}|Opts]),
 2082:                 case message_compare(E, Return) of
 2083:                     true ->
 2084:                         case E of
 2085:                             {errors, Errors} ->
 2086:                                 call_format_error(Errors);
 2087:                             _ ->
 2088:                                 ok
 2089:                         end,
 2090:                         BadL;
 2091:                     false ->
 2092:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 2093:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, E, Return]),
 2094: 			fail()
 2095:                 end
 2096:         end,
 2097:     lists:foldl(F, [], TestsWithOpts).
 2098: 
 2099: check_test(Config, Test, Opts) ->
 2100:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2101:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2102:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2103:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2104:     case epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, PrivDir}| Opts]) of
 2105: 	{ok,Forms} ->
 2106: 	    Errors = [E || E={error,_} <- Forms],
 2107: 	    call_format_error([E || {error,E} <- Errors]),
 2108: 	    Errors;
 2109: 	{error,Error} ->
 2110: 	    Error
 2111:     end.
 2112: 
 2113: compile_test(Config, Test0, Opts0) ->
 2114:     Test = [<<"-module(epp_test). ">>, Test0],
 2115:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2116:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2117:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2118:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2119:     Opts = [export_all,nowarn_export_all,return,nowarn_unused_record,{outdir,PrivDir}] ++ Opts0,
 2120:     case compile_file(File, Opts) of
 2121:         {ok, Ws} -> warnings(File, Ws);
 2122:         {errors, Errors}=Else ->
 2123:             call_format_error(Errors),
 2124:             Else;
 2125:         Else -> Else
 2126:     end.
 2127: 
 2128: warnings(File, Ws) ->
 2129:     case lists:append([W || {F, W} <- Ws, F =:= File]) of
 2130:         [] ->
 2131: 	    [];
 2132:         L ->
 2133: 	    call_format_error(L),
 2134: 	    {warnings, L}
 2135:     end.
 2136: 
 2137: compile_file(File, Opts) ->
 2138:     case compile:file(File, Opts) of
 2139:         {ok, _M, Ws} -> {ok, Ws};
 2140:         {error, FEs, []} -> {errors, errs(FEs, File), []};
 2141:         {error, FEs, [{File,Ws}]} -> {error, errs(FEs, File), Ws}
 2142:     end.
 2143: 
 2144: errs([{File,Es}|L], File) ->
 2145:     call_format_error(Es),
 2146:     Es ++ errs(L, File);
 2147: errs([_|L], File) ->
 2148:     errs(L, File);
 2149: errs([], _File) ->
 2150:     [].
 2151: 
 2152: %% Smoke test and coverage of format_error/1.
 2153: call_format_error([{_,M,E}|T]) ->
 2154:     _ = M:format_error(E),
 2155:     call_format_error(T);
 2156: call_format_error([]) ->
 2157:     ok.
 2158: 
 2159: epp_parse_file(File, Opts) ->
 2160:     case epp:parse_file(File, Opts) of
 2161:         {ok, Forms} ->
 2162:             {ok, unopaque_forms(Forms)};
 2163:         {ok, Forms, Other} ->
 2164:             {ok, unopaque_forms(Forms), Other}
 2165:     end.
 2166: 
 2167: unopaque_forms(Forms) ->
 2168:     [erl_parse:anno_to_term(Form) || Form <- Forms].
 2169: 
 2170: run_test(Config, Test0, Opts0) ->
 2171:     Test = [<<"-module(epp_test). -export([t/0]). ">>, Test0],
 2172:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2173:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2174:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2175:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2176:     Opts = [return, {i,PrivDir},{outdir,PrivDir}] ++ Opts0,
 2177:     {ok, epp_test, []} = compile:file(File, Opts),
 2178:     AbsFile = filename:rootname(File, ".erl"),
 2179: 
 2180:     case lists:member({feature, maybe_expr, enable}, Opts0) of
 2181:         false ->
 2182:             %% Run in node
 2183:             {module, epp_test} = code:load_abs(AbsFile, epp_test),
 2184:             Reply = epp_test:t(),
 2185:             code:purge(epp_test),
 2186:             Reply;
 2187:         true ->
 2188:             %% Run in peer with maybe_expr enabled
 2189:             {ok, Peer, Node} =
 2190:                 ?CT_PEER(#{args => ["-enable-feature","maybe_expr"],
 2191:                            connection => 0}),
 2192:             {module, epp_test} =
 2193:                 rpc:call(Node, code, load_abs, [AbsFile, epp_test]),
 2194:             Reply = rpc:call(Node, epp_test, t, []),
 2195:             peer:stop(Peer),
 2196:             Reply
 2197:     end.
 2198: 
 2199: fail() ->
 2200:     ct:fail(failed).
 2201: 
 2202: message_compare(T, T) ->
 2203:     T =:= T.
